episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of fascinating topics including the unique eating habits of hagfish, the history of Time magazine's Person of the Year, the unconventional methods of Franciscan monks, and a Canadian cheesemaker's attempt to improve cheese by submerging it in a lake.

facts.fact: Hagfish can eat by sitting inside the dinner and absorbing the nutrients through the skin.
1982's Time Person of the Year was the personal computer. The article announcing it was written on a typewriter.
In order to decide which direction to go and preach every day, Franciscans spun round and round until they were so dizzy that they fell over and then went in whichever way their head was pointing.
In 2004, a Canadian cheesemaker dropped fifty thousand dollars worth of cheese into a lake to make it taste better, but then lost the cheese.
